Single de Caetano Veloso|accessdate=4 June 2017|work=[[Apple Music]]|date=28 April 2017}}</ref> | endtheme = | composer = | country = Brazil | language = Portuguese | num_seasons = | num_episodes = 172 | list_episodes = | executive_producer = | producer = | editor = | location = {{Plainlist| * [[Belém]] * [[Manaus]] * [[Rio de Janeiro]] }} | cinematography = | camera = [[Multi-camera]] | runtime = 29–73 minutes | company = [[Estúdios Globo]] | distributor = | budget = | network = [[Rede Globo]] | picture_format = [[1080i]] [[HDTV]] | audio_format = | first_run = | released = <!-- {{Start date|df=yes|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | first_aired = {{Start date|2017|04|03|df=yes}} | last_aired = {{End date|2017|10|20|df=yes}} | preceded_by = ''[[A Lei do Amor]]'' | followed_by = ''[[O Outro Lado do Paraíso]]'' | related = | website = http://gshow.globo.com/novelas/a-forca-do-querer/ | website_title = | production_website = | production_website_title = }} '''''A Força do Querer''''' (English title: '''''Edge of Desire'''''<!--; [[literal and figurative language|literal meaning]]: '''''The Force of Will'''''-->) is a Brazilian [[telenovela]] produced and aired by [[Rede Globo]]. It was created by [[Glória Perez]] and directed by Rogério Gomes and [[Pedro Vasconcellos]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gshow.globo.com/tv/noticia/2016/12/nova-novela-das-9-conheca-trama-e-os-personagens-de-forca-do-querer.html|title= Nova novela das 9: conheça a trama e os personagens de 'A Força do Querer'|website=Gshow Globo|language=Portuguese|accessdate=3 March 2017}}</ref> It premiered on 3 April 2017, replacing ''[[A Lei do Amor]].'' The show ran for 29 weeks with a total of 172 episodes and ended on 20 October 2017, replaced by ''[[O Outro Lado do Paraíso]].''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.1news.com.br/noticia/7450/diomax-martins/entretenimento/a-forca-do-querer-saiba-quando-estreia-a-substituta-de-a-lei-do-amor|title=Saiba quando estreia A Força do Querer, nova novela da Rede Globo no horário nobre.|accessdate=3 March 2017|website=1 News|language=Portuguese}}</ref>
The telenovela features an [[ensemble cast]] of [[Isis Valverde]], [[Marco Pigossi]], [[Filipe Galvão|Fiuk]], [[Bruna Linzmeyer]], [[Paolla Oliveira]], [[Juliana Paes]], [[Emilio Dantas]], [[Rodrigo Lombardi]], [[Débora Falabella]], [[Dan Stulbach]] and [[Maria Fernanda Cândido]].
The show deals with contemporary themes that affect modern Brazilian culture, such as drug trafficking, gambling and transsexuality, and has received positive reception from viewers and critics. The show achieved an average viewership of 36 points in the much-coveted 9 pm time slot.
== Production == [[File:Rio Negro - Praia do Boto Rosa - panoramio.jpg|thumb|220px|right|Indaruba served as a filming site for the fictitious town of Parazinho.]] In April 2016, [[Glória Perez]] announced her next telenovela, due to premiere in the first half of 2017. She also stated that it would be different from the ones she had produced 20 years previously, which had mainly featured different settings and culture-oriented storylines. ''A Força do Querer'' mainly features romance and is primarily shot in Brazil.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://tvefamosos.uol.com.br/colunas/flavio-ricco/2016/12/03/a-forca-do-querer--novela-da-gloria-perez-tem-titulo-novo-e-definitivo.htm|title=A Forca do Querer, novela da Gloria Perez tem-titulo novo e definitivo|first=Flávio|last=Ricco|date=3 December 2016|accessdate=2 June 2017|website=TV e Famosos|language=Portuguese}}</ref><ref name="paolla">{{cite web|url=http://emais.estadao.com.br/noticias/tv,paolla-oliveira-confirma-que-sera-protagonista-da-proxima-novela-de-gloria-perez,10000027260|title=Paolla Oliveira sera protagonista da proxima novela de Glória Perez|accessdate=2 June 2017|website=E Mais|language=Portuguese}}</ref> Originally titled ''À Flor da Pele'' during the early stages of production, it was changed to ''Flor do Querer'' in November 2016 and to the current title in December.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://observatoriodatelevisao.bol.uol.com.br/noticia-da-tv/2016/11/gloria-perez-justifica-novo-titulo-para-a-flor-da-pele-estava-registrado|title=Glória Perez justifica novo título para À Flor da Pele: "Estava registrado"|accessdate=2 June 2017|website=Observatorio da Televisao|language=Portuguese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://rd1.com.br/proxima-novela-de-gloria-perez-tem-titulo-alterado-flor-do-querer-deve-ser-escolhido/|title=Próxima novela de Glória Perez tem título alterado; "Flor do Querer" deve ser escolhido|website=RD1|accessdate=2 June 2017|language=Portuguese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://oplanetatv.clickgratis.com.br/noticias/bastidores/a-forca-do-querer-e-o-titulo-definitivo-da-novela-de-gloria-perez.html|title=A Força do Querer é o título definitivo da novela de Glória Perez|accessdate=2 June 2017|website=O Planeta TV|language=Portuguese}}</ref>
=== Casting === [[Paolla Oliveira]] was the first to be cast for the project, and was announced to star in the telenovela in March 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://revistaquem.globo.com/QUEM-News/noticia/2016/03/paolla-oliveira-sera-policial-em-nova-novela.html|title=Paolla Oliveira sera policial em nova novela|website=Revistaquem Globo|language=Portuguese|accessdate=2 June 2017}}</ref><ref name="paolla" /> [[Fábio Assunção]] was originally cast to portray Eugênio but later declined in order to star in an upcoming television series.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://kogut.oglobo.globo.com/noticias-da-tv/coluna/noticia/2016/06/fabio-assuncao-sera-o-mocinho-da-novela-de-gloria-perez.html|title=Fabio Assunção será o mocinho da novela de Gloria Perez|first=Patricia|last=Kogut|date=18 June 2016|work=Kogut O Globo|accessdate=15 May 2016|language=Portuguese}}</ref> [[Dan Stulbach]] was then cast.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://kogut.oglobo.globo.com/noticias-da-tv/coluna/noticia/2016/11/dan-stulbach-voltara-globo-em-papel-que-seria-de-fabio-assuncao.html|title=Dan Stulbach voltará à Globo em papel que seria de Fabio Assunção|first=Florence|last=Manza|work=Patrícia Kogut O Globo|accessdate=15 May 2017|language=Portuguese}}</ref> Leopoldo Pacheco was originally cast as Junqueira but he and Chay Suede preferred ''[[Novo Mundo (telenovela)|Novo Mundo]]''. Suede was the first option to portray Ruy. Daniel Rocha also auditioned for the role of Ruy but [[Filipe Galvão|Fiuk]] was preferred over him.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://aguinaldosilva.com.br/2016/11/23/reprovado-em-teste-para-a-flor-da-pele-daniel-rocha-entra-para-o-elenco-de-a-lei-do-amor/|title=Reprovado em teste para ‘À Flor da Pele’, Daniel Rocha entra para o elenco de ‘A Lei do Amor’|first=Aguinaldo|last=Silva|date=23 November 2016|accessdate=15 May 2017|language=Portuguese}}</ref> [[Vera Fischer (actress)|Vera Fischer]] was also cast but due to personal differences with the showrunner, she was replaced by [[Betty Faria]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://entretenimento.r7.com/blogs/keila-jimenez/2017/03/07/vera-fischer-perde-vaga-para-betty-faria-em-novela/|title=Vera Fischer perde vaga para Betty Faria em novela|first=Keila|last=Jimenez|date=7 March 2017|work=Entretenimento|accessdate=15 May 2017|language=Portuguese}}</ref>
The character of Bibi was inspired by Fabiana Escobar, known as "queen of pot". Showrunner [[Glória Perez]] initially wanted the character to be the center of a separate miniseries but decided to include it in the telenovela.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://caras.uol.com.br/tv/gloria-perez-fara-minisserie-sobre-ex-primeira-dama-do-trafico|title=Glória Perez fará minissérie sobre ex-primeira dama do tráfico|first=Flavia|last=Faccini|date=16 April 2014|accessdate=15 May 2017|language=Portuguese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://extra.globo.com/tv-e-lazer/telinha/em-flor-da-pele-juliana-paes-fara-bandida-inspirada-em-bibi-perigosa-20036599.html|title=Em 'À flor da pele', Juliana Paes fará bandida inspirada em Bibi Perigosa|first=Carla|last=Bittencourt|date=6 September 2016|accessdate=15 May 2017|website=Extra Telinha|language=Portuguese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://cultura.estadao.com.br/noticias/geral,autora-planeja-serie-com-dama-da-rocinha-imp-,1553405|title=Autora planeja série com dama da Rocinha|first=Cristina|last=Padiglione|accessdate=15 May 2017|website=Cultura|language=Portuguese}}</ref>
Since her role is inspired by a [[Siren (mythology)|siren]], [[Isis Valverde]] was prepared for three months in readiness for her role by Mirella Ferraz a professional in that part.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ego.globo.com/famosos/noticia/2016/08/isis-valverde-sera-uma-sereia-na-novela-novela-de-gloria-perez.html|title=Isis Valverde será uma sereia na próxima novela de Glória Perez|first=Luciana |last=Tecidio|work=Ego Globo|date=24 August 2016|accessdate=15 May 2017|language=Portuguese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://ego.globo.com/televisao/noticia/2017/01/isis-valverde-usou-cauda-de-sereia-de-30kg-para-gravar-forca-do-querer.html|title=Isis Valverde usa cauda de sereia de 30kg para gravar 'A Força do Querer'|first=Victor|last=Hugo|work=Ego Globo|date=31 January 2017|accessdate=15 May 2017|language=Portuguese}}</ref>{{clarify|date=September 2018|Does this mean vocal coaching/singing training or something else?}}
== Plot == Promising lawyer Caio is considered for administering the Garcia Company, one of the largest in the country. However, when Bibi decides to end their relationship, he leaves everything behind and relocates to the United States. Fifteen years later, Caio returns to Brazil to take up a position in the judiciary and meets once again with Bibi, who failed to complete college and is married to Rubinho. Rubinho goes through a delicate financial condition, as he and Bibi struggle to make ends meet which forces him to enter the world of crime.
Ruy is prepared to take over the company of his father Eugênio, as the only qualified heir. Ruy is engaged to Cibele, who gives him professional and personal stability. When he travels to Parazinho, he is enchanted by Ritinha, a young woman who loves the fascination she exerts upon men and seems to believe herself to be a mermaid. She continues a game of seduction with Ruy despite being engaged to Zeca, a truck driver who loves her intensely despite gossip about her activities. On the day of their wedding he learns of Ritinha's fling with Ruy; fearing his temper, Ritinha runs away with Ruy while Zeca angrily leaves Parazinho. In another town, Zeca meets Jeiza, a police officer who dreams of becoming a [[mixed martial arts]] fighter.
Meanwhile, Ruy's sister Ivana has been undergoing [[female to male gender reassignment]], causing conflict with their mother, Joyce. Joyce's relationship with Eugênio begins to crumble when he meets Irene, who tries to tempt him away. And Eugênio's older brother Eurico tries to keep everyone under his control though he can't control the gambling addiction of his wife Silvana.

== Soundtrack == === ''A Força do Querer: Vol. 1'' === {{Infobox album | name = A Força do Querer: Vol. 1 | type = Soundtrack | artist = Various artists | cover = A Força do Querer Volume 1.jpg | alt = | released = 2 June 2017 | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = {{Flatlist| * [[Pop music|Pop]] * [[Música popular brasileira|MPB]] }} | length = | label = [[Som Livre]] | producer = | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = }}
'''''A Força do Querer: Vol. 1''''' is the first installment of the series of soundtracks of the telenovela.
The album consist of an original score by [[Roberto Carlos (singer)|Roberto Carlos]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gshow.globo.com/Musica/noticia/roberto-carlos-faz-1-musica-por-encomenda-da-carreira-a-pedido-de-gloria-perez.ghtml|title=Roberto Carlos faz 1ª música por encomenda da carreira a pedido de Gloria Perez|accessdate=4 June 2017|website=Gshow|language=Portuguese}}</ref> "Sereia" (released on 5 April 2017) was composed specifically for the show.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/br/album/sereia-single/id1222148462|title=Sereia - Single de Roberto Carlos|work=[[Apple Music]]|date=5 April 2017|accessdate=4 June 2017}}</ref> {{tracklist | total_length = 58:49 | extra_column = Artist(s) | title1 = O Quereres | length1 = 3:05 | extra1 = [[Caetano Veloso]] | title2 = Sereia | length2 = 3:35 | extra2 = [[Roberto Carlos (singer)|Roberto Carlos]] | title3 = Te Faço um Cafuné | length3 = 3:44 | extra3 = Mariana Aydar | title4 = Coração Machucado Carlos | length4 = 3:40 | extra4 = [[Wesley Safadão]] | title5 = Eu Sei de Cor | length5 = 2:54 | extra5 = Marília Mendonça | title6 = Boto Namorador | length6 = 4:05 | extra6 = [[Dona Onete]] | title7 = Pra Você | length7 = 3:11 | extra7 = [[Roberta Sá]] | title8 = Flor do Ipê | length8 = 2:43 | extra8 = [[Marisa Monte]] | title9 = City | length9 = 3:10 | extra9 = Kristen Marie | title10 = [[True Colors (Cyndi Lauper song)|True Colors]] | length10 = 3:45 | extra10= [[Cyndi Lauper]] | title11 = [[Nobody But Me (Michael Bublé song)|Nobody But Me]] | length11 = 3:00 | extra11= [[Michael Bublé]] | title12 = Sob Medida | length12 = 3:42 | extra12= [[Fafá de Belém]] | title13 = Deixa Eu Te Amar | length13 = 4:03 | extra13= Agepê | title14 = Para Uso Exclusivo da Casa | length14 = 3:54 | extra14= Dhi Ribeiro | title15 = Tem Que Provar Que Merece | length15 = 3:45 | extra15= [[Xande de Pilares]] | title16 = Tim Tim Por Tim Tim | length16 = 2:46 | extra16= [[Diogo Nogueira]] | title17 = I Hate U, I Love U | length17 = 3:18 | extra17= [[Gnash (musician)|Gnash]] | title18 = [[Darkness and Light (album)|Darkness and Light]] | length18 = 3:49 | extra18= [[John Legend]] }}

[[Ney Matogrosso]], Oswaldo Montenegro, Laila Garin and Elisa Lucinda | length15 = 4:55 | title16 = [[Waves (Dean Lewis song)|Waves]] | extra16= [[Dean Lewis]] | length16 = 4:01 | title17 = [[Blame (Calvin Harris song)|Blame]] | extra17= [[Calvin Harris]] feat. [[John Newman (singer)|John Newman]] | length17 = 3:34 }}
== Reception == === Ratings === The telenovela had an average daily reach of 45 million viewers (number of people who watch at least one minute of the telenovela every day). The plot also swept across social networks and ranked first on the Social Wit List in April 2017, a ranking that highlights the most-commented releases in [[Latin America]].<ref>[http://www.globotvinternational.com/newsDet.asp?newsId=629&random=1505613961694 Globo experiences the best semester in the last five years with high prime time ratings]</ref>
{| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:20%;" rowspan="2"| Timeslot <br/> ([[Time in Brazil|AT]]) ! style="width:7%;" rowspan="2"| {{abbr|Eps.|episodes (number of)}} ! colspan=2| Premiere ! colspan=2| Finale ! style="width:5%;" rowspan="2"| Rank ! style="width:7%;" rowspan="2"| TV season ! style="width:10%; background:#ffdead;" rowspan="2"| Average viewership |- ! Date ! span style="width:11%; font-size:smaller; line-height:100%;"| Viewers (in points) ! Date ! span style="width:11%; font-size:smaller; line-height:100%;"| Viewers (in points) |- | rowspan="1" | <center> Monday{{ndash}}Saturday <br />9:15 pm</center> ! 172 | style="font-size:11px;line-height:110%"|<div style="text-align: center;">3 April 2017</div> ! 33<ref name="1.1">{{cite web|url=http://www.otvfoco.com.br/a-forca-do-querer-estreia-com-2a-maior-audiencia-desde-2014-em-sp-e-rio-confira-os-consolidados-desta-segunda-feira-030417/|title=A Força do Querer estreia com 2a maior audiencia desde 2014 em SP e Rio: Confira os consolidados deste Segunda-feira 03/04/17|website=O TV Foco|language=Portuguese |accessdate=16 April 2017}}</ref> | style="font-size:11px;line-height:110%"|<div style="text-align: center;">20 October 2017</div> ! 50<ref name="1.172">{{cite web|first1=Vitor|last1=Pecolli|date=23 October 2017|url=http://www.otvfoco.com.br/final-de-a-forca-do-querer-bate-recorde-de-audiencia-desde-avenida-brasil-confira-os-consolidados-da-sexta-feira-201017/|title=Final de "A Força do Querer" bate recorde de audiência desde "Avenida Brasil"; confira os consolidados da sexta-feira (20/10/17)|website=O TV Foco|language=Portuguese |accessdate=23 October 2017}}</ref> ! 1<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.kantaribopemedia.com/audiencia-do-horario-nobre-15-mercados-0210-a-08102017/|title=Audiência do horário nobre|work=Kantar Ibope Media|language=Portuguese|accessdate=20 October 2017}}</ref> ! style="font-size:smaller" | [[2017 in television|2017]] ! style="background:#fc9;" |36<ref name="Av"/> |}
On its premiere, ''A Força do Querer'' registered a viewership rating of 32.9 points, the highest premiere viewership since the 2016 debut of ''[[Velho Chico]]''.<ref name="1.1" /> On its first week of broadcast, it recorded an average of 32 points. It had the second-largest viewership, after ''[[Amor à Vida]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://noticiasdatv.uol.com.br/noticia/audiencias/a-forca-do-querer-tem-bom-inicio-no-ibope-e-supera-a-lei-do-amor-14678|title="A Força do Querer tem bom início no Ibope e supera "A Lei do Amor" |work=Noticias da Tv|language=Portuguese|accessdate=20 October 2017}}</ref>
The penultimate episode, that aired on 19 October, recorded 48.8 points of average and peaking at 51 points with a 65% share, hitting the record, according to consolidated data of Ibope in Greater São Paulo. With this indices, ''A Força do Querer'' had the highest audience since the last episode of ''[[Avenida Brasil (telenovela)|Avenida Brasil]]'', which recorded 52 points on 19 October 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.otvfoco.com.br/forca-querer-tem-maior-audiencia-desde-avenida-brasil-no-penultimo-capitulo-confira-os-consolidados-desta-quinta-feira-191017/|title="A Força do Querer" tem maior audiência desde "Avenida Brasil" no penúltimo capítulo; confira os consolidados desta quinta-feira (19/10/17)|first1=Vitor|last1=Peccoli|date=20 October 2017|work=O TV Foco|language=Portuguese|accessdate=20 October 2017}}</ref>
On the finale, ''A Força do Querer'' had the largest audience since the end of ''Avenida Brasil''. Having aired from 9:15 pm to 11:32 pm, the final episode had a record-setting 50.1 points and peaked at 53 points. These were the best ratings since the finale of ''Avenida Brasil'', which had 51.7 points on 19 October 2012. In Rio de Janeiro, the last episode recorded 49 points in average (highest final indices since ''[[Império]]'', which had 50 points).<ref name="1.172"/>
Cumulatively, the show recorded an average rating of 35.67.<ref name="1.172"/><ref name="Av">{{cite web|url=http://gabrielfarac.blogspot.com.br/2017/03/a-forca-do-querer-audiencia-detalhada.html|title=A Força do Querer – Audiência Detalhada|work=Gabriel Farc|language=Portuguese}}</ref>
== Controversies ==
=== The state of Pará === Since its debut, the telenovela received criticism for not using the [[Northeast Region, Brazil|northeastern]] [[Brazilian Portuguese|accents]] in the state of [[Pará]] and the depiction of the state, such as the existence of an aquarium located in Ver-o-Peso. There were varied opinions among the viewers, especially those from Pará. [[Rede Globo]] and show's creator [[Glória Perez]] said that the show was not set in the capital of Pará but in the fictional city of Parazinho and that the work of fiction has no commitment to be true to reality.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.opovo.com.br/divirtase/2017/04/paraenses-criticam-nordestinacao-do-para-em-a-forca-do-querer.html|title=Paraenses criticam nordestinação do Pará em A Força do Querer|work=O Povo|language=Portuguese}}</ref>
=== Accusations on glamorization of drug trafficking === The fact that the plot touches on drug trafficking and other crime aroused the idea that the telenovela was unapologetic to such. The show to received a flurry of criticism, mainly by evangelists and conservatives.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.terra.com.br/diversao/tv/blog-sala-de-tv/acha-mesmo-que-novela-transforma-uma-pessoa-em-bandido,8343e0c62cc38b4a56197235ac7a27c9t0onos6c.html|title=Acha mesmo que novela transforma uma pessoa em bandido?|accessdate=13 October 2017|language=Portuguese}}</ref> Pastor and Deputy Marco Feliciano said that, "Rede Globo offered a course for banditry".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://noticias.gospelmais.com.br/feliciano-globo-curso-bandido-a-forca-do-querer-92654.html|title=Marco Feliciano ataca a Globo e diz que emissora promove "curso para bandido" na novela A Força do Querer|work=Noticias|language=Portuguese}}</ref> Showrunner Glória Perez responded to the accusations: {{quote|It is something of people to want to put reality under the rug. Bibi became a thug. She is not the trafficker, but she is prosecuted by association with trafficking. Do you see glamour in that? The plot brings an ethical police, quite different from how it is traditionally shown in Brazilian dramas. These people [critics] make me sleepy.<ref>{{cite web|title=Glória Perez nega glamourização do tráfico em A Força do Querer: "Essa gente me dá sono"|url=https://observatoriodatelevisao.bol.uol.com.br/noticia-da-tv/2017/09/gloria-perez-nega-glamourizacao-do-trafico-em-a-forca-do-querer-essa-gente-me-da-sono|work=|publisher=|accessdate=13 October 2017|date=September 2017}}</ref>}}
=== Transexuality === Before the debut of the telenovela, the subject of transexuality was already causing controversy. Catholic organizations asked that Globo not allow this theme in the show.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blog.opovo.com.br/ancoradouro/bispo-conclama-tsunami-de-e-mails-para-stf-e-tv-globo-contra-aborto-e-ideologia-de-genero/|title=Bispo conclama 'tsunami' de e-mails para STF e TV Globo contra Aborto e Ideologia de Gênero|accessdate=13 October 2017|language=Portuguese}}</ref> The theme about gender identity, addressed in the plot by the character Ivana was also not accepted by a portion of the audience, among them also evangelists and conservatives. They accused the network of using the telenovela to popularize gender ideology.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://noticias.gospelmais.com.br/globo-novela-a-forca-do-querer-ideologia-de-genero-89914.html|title=Globo vai usar novela A Força do Querer, de Glória Perez, para popularizar ideologia de gênero|accessdate=13 October 2017|language=Portuguese}}</ref> According to them, the telenovela had a clear intention to show that it is completely normal to identify as one gender even if one is of the other.

revision.text:
{{for|the black/death metal band|Anagnorisis (band)}} {{for|the German musician|Anagnorisis (Sariola)}} '''Anagnorisis''' ({{IPAc-en|ˌ|æ|n|ə|ɡ|ˈ|n|ɒr|ᵻ|s|ᵻ|s}}; {{lang-grc|ἀναγνώρισις}}) is a moment in a play or other work when a character makes a critical discovery. Anagnorisis originally meant [[Recall (memory)|recognition]] in its Greek context, not only of a person but also of what that person stood for. Anagnorisis was the [[hero]]'s sudden awareness of a real situation, the realisation of things as they stood, and finally, the hero's insight into a relationship with an often [[antagonist]]ic [[fictional character|character]] in [[Aristotle|Aristotelian]] [[tragedy]].[[Northrop Frye]], "Myth, Fiction, And Displacement" p 25 ''Fables of Identity: Studies in Poetic Mythology'', {{ISBN|0-15-629730-2}} ==Tragedy== In his ''[[Poetics (Aristotle)|Poetics]]'', as part of his discussion of [[peripeteia]], Aristotle defined anagnorisis as "a change from ignorance to knowledge, producing love or hate between the persons destined by the poet for good or bad fortune" (1452a). It is often discussed along with Aristotle's concept of [[catharsis]]. [[File:Lear and Cordelia.jpg|right|thumb|"Lear and Cordelia" by [[Ford Madox Brown]]: Lear, driven out by his older daughters and rescued by his youngest, realizes their true characters.]] In the [[Aristotelianism|Aristotelian]] definition of tragedy, it was the discovery of one's own identity or true character (e.g. Cordelia, Edgar, Edmund, etc. in [[Shakespeare]]'s ''[[King Lear]]'') or of someone else's identity or true nature (e.g. Lear's children, Gloucester's children) by the tragic hero. Aristotle was the first writer to discuss the uses of anagnorisis, with peripeteia caused by it. He considered it the mark of a superior tragedy, as when [[Oedipus]] killed his father and married his mother in ignorance, and later learned the truth, or when [[Iphigeneia in Tauris]] realizes in time that the strangers she is to sacrifice are her brother and his friend, and refrains from sacrificing them. Aristotle considered these complex plots superior to simple plots without anagnorisis or peripeteia, such as when [[Medea]] resolves to kill her children, knowing they are her children, and does so. Another prominent example of anagnorisis in tragedy is in [[Aeschylus]]'s "The Choephoroi" ("[[Libation Bearers]]") when [[Electra]] recognizes her brother, [[Orestes]], after he has returned to [[Argos]] from his exile, at the grave of their father, [[Agamemnon]], who had been murdered at the hands of [[Clytemnestra]], their mother. [[Electra]] convinces herself that Orestes is her brother with three pieces of evidence: a lock of Orestes's hair on the grave, his footprints next to the grave, and a piece of weaving which she embroidered herself. The footprints and the hair are identical to her own. Electra's awareness is of her brother's presence, who is the one person who can help her by avenging the death of their father. Aeschylus, and Robert Lowell. The Oresteia of Aeschylus. New York: Farrar, Straus, Giroux, 1978. ==Comedy== [[File:Robson Crane Comedy of Errors.jpg|right|thumb|Poster for a performance of ''[[The Comedy of Errors]]'': When the twins, confused with each other throughout the play, recognize each other's existence, the play reaches its happy ending.]] The section of Aristotle's ''Poetics'' dealing with comedy did not survive, but many critics also discuss recognition in comedies. A standard plot of the [[New Comedy]] was the final revelation, by birth tokens, that the heroine was of respectable birth and so suitable for the hero to marry. This was often brought about by the machinations of the [[tricky slave]]. This plot appears in Shakespeare's ''[[The Winter's Tale]]'', where a recognition scene in the final act reveals that Perdita is a king's daughter rather than a shepherdess, and so suitable for her prince lover.Northrop Frye, "Recognition in ''The Winter's Tale''" p 108-9 ''Fables of Identity: Studies in Poetic Mythology'', {{ISBN|0-15-629730-2}} ==Literature and modern usage== ===Mystery=== The earliest use of anagnorisis in a [[Crime fiction|murder mystery]] was in "[[The Three Apples]]", a classical ''[[One Thousand and One Nights|Arabian Nights]]'' tale, where the device is employed to great effect in its [[twist ending]].[[Wikisource:The Tale of the Three Apples]] The protagonist of the story, [[Ja'far ibn Yahya]], is ordered by [[Harun al-Rashid]] to find the culprit behind a murder mystery within three days or else be executed. It is only after the deadline has passed, and as he prepares to be executed, that he discovers that the culprit was his own slave all along.{{citation|title=Story-Telling Techniques in the Arabian Nights|first=David|last=Pinault|publisher=[[Brill Publishers]]|year=1992|isbn=90-04-09530-6|pages=95–6}}{{citation|title=The Arabian Nights Reader|first=Ulrich|last=Marzolph|publisher=[[Wayne State University Press]]|year=2006|isbn=0-8143-3259-5|pages=241–2}} ===Modern usage=== Anagnorisis, however, is not limited to classical or Elizabethan sources. Author and lecturer Ivan Pintor Iranzo points out that contemporary ''auteur'' [[M. Night Shyamalan]] uses similar revelations in ''[[The Sixth Sense]]'', in which child psychologist Malcolm Crowe successfully treats a child who is having visions of dead people, only to realize at the close of the film that Crowe himself is dead, as well as in ''[[Unbreakable (film)|Unbreakable]]'', in which the character of David realizes that he survived a train crash that killed the other passengers, due to a supernatural power.Ivan Pintor Iranzo. [http://www.upf.edu/materials/depeca/formats/arti6_ing.htm The naked and the dead. The Representation of the dead and the construction of the other in contemporary cinema: The case of M. Night Shyamalan], No. 4, 2005 Another well known example of anagnorisis from popular culture is the revelation that [[Darth Vader]] is the father of [[Luke Skywalker]] in ''[[The Empire Strikes Back]]''. An extensive account of the history and application of anagnorisis is provided by Terence Cave in his book ''Recognitions''.''Recognitions: A Study in Poetics''. Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1988. A humorous definition is included in 'The Banner: mock-heroic verse epic, Part 1: Sid' by Robin Gordon:
In any moment of such crisis / one thinks, of course, of those devices / which Aristotle said were needed / in any poem. We have heeded / Aristotle, and our plot, / (beginning, middle, end), has got / complications too, and error / fit to rouse cathartic terror, / protagonists, antagonists, / peripiteia, turns and twists. / The poet's comments form the choruses, / but now it's time for anagnorisis. / When Oedipus sees the bird he's bedded / is his own father's lawful wedded / wife, in fact she is his mother, / or Iphigenia finds her brother, / Discovery or Recognition / brings the plot to its fruition.
==See also== *[[Aristotle]] *[[Back-story]] *[[Denouement]] *[[Epiphany (feeling)|Epiphany]] *[[Peripeteia]] *[[Tragedy]] ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Ancient Greek theatre]] [[Category:Literary concepts]] [[Category:Narratology]] [[Category:Plot (narrative)]] [[Category:Poetics]] [[Category:Fiction]]

'''Antilabe''' (from the [[Ancient Greek|Greek]]: ἀντι "mutually" or "corresponding", λαβή, "grip" or "handle") is a [[rhetoric]]al technique in [[verse drama and dramatic verse|verse drama]] or [[closet drama]], in which a single [[Line (poetry)|verse line]] of dialogue is distributed on two or more [[Character (arts)|characters]], voices, or entities. The verse usually maintains its [[Metre (poetry)|metric]] integrity, while the line fragments spoken by the characters may or may not be complete sentences. In the layout of the text the line fragments following the first one are often indented ("[[dropped line]]") to show the unity of the verse line. {{Quotation| '''BRUTUS''':
:Peace then. No words. '''CLITUS''':
::::::::I'll rather kill myself.| [[William Shakespeare|Shakespeare]]|[[Julius Caesar (play)|''Julius Caesar'']]}} These are three sentences spoken by two persons. But it is only one single line in [[blank verse]]: :Peace '''then'''. No '''words'''. I'll '''ra'''ther '''kill''' my'''self'''. ==In Ancient Greek drama== "The device originated in [[tragedy|classical tragedy]] as a means of heightening dramatic tension."Eggenberger, David. ''McGraw-Hill Encyclopedia of World Drama''. Volume 1. 1972, p. 219. "It figures in almost all the plays of [[Sophocles]] and [[Euripides]]. It renders dialogue less stately and more agitated: the technique is well suited to scenes of excitement, in which one speaker is repeatedly capping, countering or following up the ideas of another."Rutherford, R. B. ''Greek Tragic Style: Form, Language and Interpretation''. Cambridge University Press, 2012, p. 42. In Sophokles’ ''[[Oedipus Rex|Oedipus]]'', for example, "as ''Kreon'' seizes ''Antigone'' (832), they break into an excited lyrical strophe, full of ''antilabe'' in which ''Oedipus'', ''Kreon'', and the chorus participate."Edmunds, Lowell. ''Theatrical Space and Historical Place in Sophocles' Oedipus at Colonus''. Maryland, Rowman & Littlefield, 1996, p. 61. "In ''[[Electra (Sophocles)|Electra]]'' (1502-3), ''antilabe'' occurs as ''Orestes'' tries to induce ''Aegisthys'' to enter the house so that ''Orestes'' can kill him."Thorburn, John E. Jr. ''The Facts on File Companion to Classical Drama''. Facts on File (Library of World Literature) 2005, p. 56. "[Antilabe is] used with particular freedom in late Euripides."Rutherford, p. 42. "In the plays of [[Aeschylus]], with the possible exception of ''[[Prometheus Bound]]'' (line 980), this phenomenon does not occur." Thorburn, p. 56. ==In Seneca drama== "Dialogic exchanges using both ''[[stichomythia]]'' and ''antilabe'' are common in [[Seneca the Younger|Seneca]]. They occur in all the tragedies except ''Phoenissiae''."Boyle, A. J. ed. ''Seneca: Medea: Edited with Introduction, Translation, and Commentary''. Oxford University Press, 2014, p. 166. ==In Renaissance drama== David Eggenberger notes that "[the device] was frequently utilized by [[Renaissance]] dramatists."Eggenberger, p. 219. An extreme example from Shakespeare is: {{Quotation|Death? ::My lord? ::::A grave. ::::::He shall not live.|''[[The Life and Death of King John|King John]]'', 3.3}} ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==References== *Bonaria, Mario. "Lantilabé nella tragedia antica." In ''Studi di filologica in onore di Giusto Monaco''. I, ''Letteratura greca''. Palermo: University di Palermo Fac. di Lettere e Filosofia, 1991, pp. 173–188. *McDevitt, A. S. "Antilabe in Sophoclean Kommoi," In ''Rheinisches Museum'' 124 (1981), pp. 19–28. *Gildersleeve, Basil Lanneau, Miller, Charles William Emil and Meritt, Benjamin Dean Meritt . ''American Journal of Philology.'' Volumes 41-60. 1939, p. 183. *Hogan, Robert. ''The Dramatic Function of Antilabe in Greek Tragedy''. Trinity College, 1998. [[Category:Drama]] [[Category:Literary terminology]] [[Category:Poetic form]] [[Category:Rhetorical techniques]]

revision.text:
The '''Atellan Farce''' ([[Latin language|Latin]]: ''Atellanae Fabulae'' or ''Fabulae Atellanae'',<ref>{{Cite book|title=The Commedia Dell'Arte|last=Smith|first=Winifred|publisher=Benjamin Blom|year=1964|isbn=|location=New York|pages=24|quote=The extemporary compositions called Fabulae Atellanae...|via=}}</ref> "favola atellana";<ref>{{Cite book|title=The Italian Theatre: From Its Beginning to the close of the Seventeenth Century|last=Kennard|first=Joseph|publisher=Benjamin Blom|year=1964|isbn=|location=New York|pages=5|quote=Another early form of drama, was the Atellanian fable (favola atellana), so called from the Etruscan city Atella.|via=}}</ref> ''Atellanicum exhodium'', "Atella comedies"<ref>{{Cite book|title=The Commedia dell'Arte|last=Oreglia|first=Giacomo|publisher=Hill and Wang|year=1968|isbn=|location=New York|pages=78|quote=...the Pappus of Atella comedies|via=}}</ref>), also known as the '''Oscan Games''' ([[Latin language|Latin]]: ''ludi Osci'', "Oscan plays"), were masked improvised farces.<ref>{{Cite book|title=The Commedia Dell'Arte|last=Smith|first=Winifred|publisher=Benjamin Blom|year=1964|isbn=|location=New York|pages=26|quote= Atellnae were farces marked by improvisation and masked personages,|via=}}</ref> It was very popular in [[Ancient Rome]], and usually put on after longer plays like the [[pantomime]].<ref>{{Cite book|title=The Italian Comedy|last=Duchartre|first=Pierre|publisher=Dover Publications, INC|year=1966|isbn=|location=New York|pages=25|quote=They were later called Exodiae, because they were often given at the end of the performance.|via=}}</ref> The name is believed to have been derived from [[Atella]], an [[Oscan]] town in [[Campania]], who were one of the first to have a theatre and the hypothesized point of origin of Atellan Farce.<ref>{{Cite book|title=The Italian Theatre: From Its Beginning to the close of the Seventeenth Century|last=Kennard|first=Joseph|publisher=Benjamin Blom|year=1964|isbn=|location=New York|pages=5|quote=Another early form of drama, was the Atellainian fable, so called from the Etruscan city Atella.|via=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|title=The Italian Comedy|last=Duchartre|first=Pierre|publisher=Dover Publications, INC|year=1966|isbn=|location=New York|pages=25|quote=The ancient city of Atella, now known as Aversa, was one of the first to have a theatre, in fact.|via=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|title=The Italian Comedy|last=Ducharte|first=Pierre|publisher=Dover Publications INC|year=1966|isbn=|location=New York|pages=25|quote=When performed in Rome they were called Atellanae, which became their accepted name.|via=}}</ref> They were originally written in [[Oscan]] and imported into [[Rome]] in 391 BC. In later Roman versions, only the ridiculous characters read their lines in Oscan, while the others used Latin.
==History== Atellan Farce evidence is scarce, but surviving fragments point to the comedy genre coming about no earlier than 90 BC.<ref>W.Beare Cambridge University Press, Platus and the Fabula Atellana</ref>
==Stock characters== Some of the hypothesized [[stock character]]s included: * '''Maccus''' ("The Fool", a hunchbacked, beak nosed character)<ref>{{Cite book|title=The Commedia Dell'Arte|last=Smith|first=Winifred|publisher=Benjamin Bloom|year=1964|isbn=|location=New York|pages=22|quote=A grotesque statuette representing a beak-nosed, hunchbacked individual, was unearthed at Herculaneum in 1727, which by a slight stretch of imagination could be identified with Maccus|via=}}</ref><ref name=":0">{{Cite book|title=Punch and Judy: Its Origin and Evolution|last=Byrom|first=Michael|publisher=Shiva Publications|year=1972|isbn=0902982028|location=Aberdeen|pages=4|quote=There was the old man (Pappus), the old woman, the comic slave (Centunculus), the country booby (Buccus), the arrogant soldier (Manducus), the pompous doctor (Dossenus), and the sharp-tongued hooked nosed hunchback (Maccus).|via=}}</ref> * '''Buccus''' (the country booby)<ref name=":0" /> * '''Manducus''' (the arrogant soldier)<ref name=":0" /> * '''Pappus''' (the old man)<ref name=":0" /> * '''Centunculus''' (the comic slave) <ref name=":0" /> * '''Dosseunus''' (the pompous doctor) <ref name=":0" /> There has been some debate of these characters connection to similar stock characters in [[Commedia dell'arte]], as well as [[Punch and Judy]]. Atellan Farce and Commedia were both improvised masked comedies. Some Historians argue that the stock characters in Atellan Farce are the beginnings of what would become the stock characters of Commedia dell'arte.
Some of the theorized character progressions are as follows: * '''Pappus''' → [[Pantalone]]<ref>{{Cite book|title=The Italian Comedy|last=Duchartre|first=Peirre|publisher=Dover Publications, INC|year=1966|isbn=|location=New York|pages=17|quote=The ancestor of Pantaloon, and his son Harpagon, is Pappus, the lecherous old miser of the Antellane|via=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|title=The Commedia dell'Arte|last=Oreglia|first=Giacomo|publisher=Hill and Wang|year=1968|isbn=|location=New York|pages=78|quote=In the ancient theatre the characters which recall this Mask are those of the various old men of Aristophanes, Plautus, Terence, and the Pappus of the Atella comedies|via=}}</ref> * '''Maccus+Buccu'''s → [[Pulcinella]]<ref>{{Cite book|title=The Italian Comedy|last=Duchartre|first=Pierre|publisher=The Dover Publications, INC|year=1966|isbn=|location=New York|pages=18|quote=The cradle of the family was the ancient city of Atella, in the Roman Campangna, and the gallery of ancestors shows, among others Bucco and the sensual Maccus, whose lean figure and cowardly nature reappear in Pulcinella|via=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|title=The Italian Comedy|last=Duchartre|first=Pierre|publisher=Dover Publication, INC|year=1966|isbn=|location=|pages=29|quote=Pulcinella was always dressed in white like Maccus, the mimus albus, or white mime|via=}}</ref> * '''Manducus''' → [[il Capitano]]<ref>{{Cite book|title=The Italian Comedy|last=Duchartre|first=Pierre|publisher=The Dover Publications, INC|year=1966|isbn=|location=New York|pages=18|quote=Next there is the ogre Manducus, the Miles Glorious in the plays of Plautus, who is later metamorphosed into the swaggering Captain, or Captain.|via=}}</ref> However, the connection of Atellan Farce to Commedia dell'arte and assumption that Atellan Farce is the precursor to Commedia dell'arte is still under debate.<ref>{{Cite book|title=The Commedia Dell'Arte|last=Smith|first=Winifred|publisher=Benjamin Blom|year=1964|isbn=|location=New York|pages=21|quote=page 21 Not a little nonsense has been written about the “evolution” of the commedai dell’arte. Of the three main theories that attempt to account for our farces the hoariest and most outgrown is that concerning their putative Roman father, surely a ghost that by now ought to be permately laid.|via=}}</ref> As for Atellan Farce's connection to Punch and Judy, the similarities between Punch and the Commedia dell'arte character Pulcinella are notable. However, many historians still debate whether or not Punch's derivation can be traced back to Pulcinella.<ref>{{Cite book|title=The Commedia Dell'Arte|last=Smith|first=Winifred|publisher=Benjamin Blom|year=1964|isbn=|location=New York|pages=23|quote=The identification of the statuette with a future in the Mimes or even with a stage character at all is very uncertain, nor is it safe to press its resemblance to the English Punch; there is no doubt that it looks like Punch but this, I think, is vest explained by the fame of the figure at the time of its discovery and by the influence of its peculiarities on the face and figure of the English villain-clown.|via=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|title=Punch and Judy: Its Origin and Evolution|last=Byrom|first=Michael|publisher=Shiva Publications|year=1972|isbn=0902982028|location=Aberbeen|pages=5|quote=In 1662, Pulcinella crossed the English Channel and became 'Punchinello' later to be known simply as Punch.|via=}}</ref>
==Authorship== At first, the subjects were decided upon before the performance began and the dialogue was improvised as it proceeded. The performers were the sons of Roman citizens, who did not lose their rights as citizens, and were allowed to serve in the army: professional actors were excluded. The simple prose dialogues were probably varied by songs in the rude Saturnian metre: the language was that of the common people, accompanied by lively gesticulation and movements. They were characterized by coarseness and obscenity.<ref name="EB1911">{{EB1911|inline=y|wstitle=Atellanae Fabulae|volume=2|page=824}}</ref>
Later, it is believed that the dictator [[Sulla]] wrote some Atellan Fables. [[Quintus Novius]], who flourished 50 years after the abdication of Sulla, wrote some fifty, including ''Macchus Sexul'' ("Exiled Macchus"), ''Gallinaria'' ("The Henhouse"), ''Surdus'' ("The Deaf One"), ''Vindemiatores'' ("The Harvesters"), and ''Parcus'' (“The Treasurer”).
[[Lucius Pomponius]], of [[Bologna]], is known to have composed a few, including ''Macchus Miles'' ("Macchus the Soldier"), ''Pytho Gorgonius'', ''Pseudoagamemnon'', ''Bucco Adoptatus'', and ''Aeditumus''. He was also said to have been influenced by the Palliata [[Fabius Dorsennus]]. [[Quintus Novius]] and a "Memmius" were also authors of these comedies; [[Ovid]] and [[Pliny the Younger]] found the work of Memmius to be indecent.
==Controversy and suppression== {{Citation needed|reason=I have not found any other source other than Wikipedia itself stating this information about the Atellan Farces becoming illegal |date=July 2018}} Taken from [[Tacitus]] ( [[Annals (Tacitus)|Annals]], Book 4): "...after various and often fruitless complaints from the praetors, the emperor [[Tiberius]] finally brought forward a motion about the licentious behavior of the players. 'They had often,' he said. 'Sought to disturb the public peace, and to bring disgrace on private families, and the old Oscan farce, once a wretched amusement for the vulgar, had become at once so indecent and popular, that it must be checked by the Senate's authority'. The players, upon this, were banished from Italy".
[[Suetonius]] ('' [[The Twelve Caesars#Tiberius|Tiberius]]'', 45, 1) reports that Tiberius himself was mocked for his lecherous habits in an Atellan farce, after which the saying "the old goat lapping up the doe" (''hircum vetulum capreis naturam ligurire'') became popular.
The above passage suggests a growth in popularity or maybe even a revival of these farces, in the 20s AD, that met the disapproval of an older generation of patricians and senators. Perhaps they were even performed out in public places as an act of direct hostility towards (or a means to mock) specific people or families. At any rate, these performances eventually became so obnoxious that, in 28 AD, all those who performed in these farces were banished from Italy.
The ''[[Augustan History]]'' records that [[Hadrian]] furnished performances of Atellan Farces at banquets.<ref>''HA'' Hadrian 26.</ref>

{{essay-like|date=November 2008}} {{unreferenced|date=November 2008}} Quite a number of television shows have had episodes which were narrated in [[reverse chronology]], due possibly to narrative style, some sort of [[time travel]] mechanism, or a character (or society) who perceives time passing in the opposite direction. These are not simply episodes which allow a character to travel back in time, and relive the period forward; rather they are episodes where the period of time is either experienced or recounted from the chronological end to the chronological beginning. Those incorporating a time travel mechanism may or may not allow characters to break out of their [[destiny]]. Various backwards episodes include:
* "As Time Goes By" (''[[Sliders]]'') * "[[Backwards (Red Dwarf episode)|Backwards]]" (''[[Red Dwarf]]'') * "[[Before and After (Star Trek: Voyager)|Before and After]]" (''[[Star Trek: Voyager]]'') * "[[The Betrayal]]" (''[[Seinfeld]]'') * "[[Blood of the Father, Heart of Steel]]" (''[[The Venture Bros.]]'') * "[[Redrum (The X-Files)|Redrum]]" (''[[The X-Files]]'') * "My Cheatin' Heart" (''[[Home Movies (TV series)|Home Movies]]'') * "[[ER (season 9)#Episodes|Hindsight]]" (''[[ER (TV series)|ER]]'') * "Shrabster" (''[[Sealab 2021]]'') * "Remains of the Platypus" (''[[Phineas and Ferb]]'') * "[[Yug Ylimaf]]" (''[[Family Guy]]'') * "Once Removed" (''[[Inside No. 9]]'')
==See also== * ''[[Memento (film)|Memento]]''
