===Rape=== The women who have accused Weinstein of [[rape]] include: <!-- Entries in alphabetical order by last name, then unnamed people --> # Lysette Anthony told British police in October 2017 that Weinstein raped her in the late 1980s at her home in London.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/news/harvey-weinstein-raped-me-in-my-home-british-actress-lysette-anthony-tells-police-zh2g3fdrw |title='Harvey Weinstein raped me in my home,' British actress Lysette Anthony tells police |work=[[The Sunday Times]] |first=Charlotte |last=Metcalf |date=October 15, 2017 |accessdate=October 15, 2017}}</ref> # Asia Argento told ''The New Yorker'' that in 1997, Weinstein invited her into a hotel room, "pulled her skirt up, forced her legs apart, and performed oral sex on her as she repeatedly told him to stop".<ref name="Farrow"/> # Paz de la Huerta said that Weinstein had raped her on two separate occasions in November and December 2010.<ref name="paz1"/> # Lucia Evans said that after a business meeting in 2004, Weinstein forced her to perform oral sex on him.<ref name="Farrow"/> # Hope Exiner d'Amore, a former employee of Weinstein, said that he raped her during a business trip to New York in the late 1970s.<ref name="Gabler"/> # According to Mimi Haleyi, Weinstein forcibly performed oral sex on her in his New York City apartment in 2006 when she was in her twenties.<ref>{{cite news|title=Harvey Weinstein 'forcibly performed oral sex on aspiring film production worker'|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/10/24/harvey-weinstein-forcibly-performed-oral-sex-aspiring-film-production/|accessdate=October 25, 2017|work=Telegraph|language=en|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171025142639/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/10/24/harvey-weinstein-forcibly-performed-oral-sex-aspiring-film-production/|archivedate=October 25, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref> # Dominique Huett also said that Weinstein forcibly performed oral sex on her and then carried out another sexual act in front of her.<ref>{{cite news|title=Actress Dominique Huett sues Weinstein Company after rape claim|url=https://news.sky.com/story/actress-dominique-huett-sues-weinstein-company-after-rape-claim-11097755|accessdate=October 25, 2017|work=Sky News|language=en|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171025172057/https://news.sky.com/story/actress-dominique-huett-sues-weinstein-company-after-rape-claim-11097755|archivedate=October 25, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref> # Natassia Malthe said that in 2008, Weinstein barged into her London hotel room at night and raped her.<ref name="Variety October 25, 2017"/><ref>{{cite web|last1=Battaglio|first1=Stephen|title=Actress Natassia Malthe says Harvey Weinstein raped her in 2008|url=http://www.latimes.com/business/hollywood/la-fi-ct-weinstein-natassia-malthe-20171025-story.html|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|date=October 25, 2017|accessdate=October 25, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171025233713/http://www.latimes.com/business/hollywood/la-fi-ct-weinstein-natassia-malthe-20171025-story.html|archivedate=October 25, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref> # Rose McGowan wrote on Twitter that she told the [[Amazon Studios]] head [[Roy Price]] that Weinstein had raped her, but that Price ignored this and continued collaborating with Weinstein.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Levin|first1=Sam|last2=Solon|first2=Olivia|title=Rose McGowan alleges rape by Harvey Weinstein – and Amazon ignored claim|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/12/rose-mcgowan-amazon-studios-harvey-weinstein-ignore-rape|accessdate=October 20, 2017|work=The Guardian|date=October 13, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171020013531/https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/12/rose-mcgowan-amazon-studios-harvey-weinstein-ignore-rape|archivedate=October 20, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref> Price later resigned from his post following sexual harassment allegations against him.<ref>{{cite news|title=Roy Price Resigns as Amazon Studios Head|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/roy-price-resigns-as-amazon-studios-head-1049728|accessdate=October 20, 2017|work=The Hollywood Reporter|language=en|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171018211615/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/roy-price-resigns-as-amazon-studios-head-1049728|archivedate=October 18, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref> #Annabella Sciorra said that in the early 1990s, Weinstein forced himself into her apartment, shoved her onto her bed and raped her.<ref name="Farrow2"/><ref>{{cite web|author1=Associated Press|title=Annabella Sciorra alleges she was raped by Harvey Weinstein|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/28/annabella-sciorra-alleges-rape-harvey-weinstein|website=The Guardian|accessdate=October 29, 2017|date=October 28, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171028224941/https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/28/annabella-sciorra-alleges-rape-harvey-weinstein|archivedate=October 28, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref> # An unnamed woman told ''The New Yorker'' that Weinstein invited her into a hotel room on a pretext, and "forced himself on [her] sexually" despite her protests.<ref name="Farrow"/> # An unnamed actress told the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' that in 2013, Weinstein "bullied his way" into her hotel room, grabbed her by the hair, dragged her into the bathroom and raped her.<ref name="auto1">{{cite news|last1=Winton|first1=Richard|last2=Kim|first2=Victoria|title=Harvey Weinstein raped me, actress tells LAPD. Investigation launched|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-fi-ct-weinstein-lapd-victim-20171019-story.html|accessdate=October 20, 2017|work=Los Angeles Times|date=October 19, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171020000020/http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-fi-ct-weinstein-lapd-victim-20171019-story.html|archivedate=October 20, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref> # An unnamed actress sued Weinstein for [[sexual battery]] and [[assault]], alleging that in 2016 he forced her into sex.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Faughnder|first1=Ryan|title=Harvey Weinstein and studio sued for assault and battery by an unnamed actress|url=http://www.latimes.com/business/hollywood/la-fi-ct-weinstein-lawsuit-allred-20171114-story.html|accessdate=November 25, 2017|work=Los Angeles Times|date=November 14, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171125111046/http://www.latimes.com/business/hollywood/la-fi-ct-weinstein-lawsuit-allred-20171114-story.html|archivedate=November 25, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref> <!-- Entries in alphabetical order by last name, then unnamed people -->
==Weinstein's responses== In response to the ''New York Times'' report, Weinstein said: "I appreciate the way I've behaved with colleagues in the past has caused a lot of pain, and I sincerely apologize for it." He said he was due to take a [[sabbatical]] and was working with therapists to "deal with this issue head on".<ref name="Kantor"/> His consulting lawyer, [[Lisa Bloom]], described him as "an old dinosaur learning new ways". Bloom was criticized for her handling of Weinstein's defense and ended her involvement for Weinstein on October 7, 2017.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Kantor |first1=Jodi |last2=Twohey |first2=Megan |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/07/business/lisa-bloom-weinstein-attorney.html |title=Lisa Bloom, Lawyer Advising Harvey Weinstein, Resigns Amid Criticism From Board Members |work=The New York Times |date=October 7, 2017 |accessdate=October 10, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171009205638/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/07/business/lisa-bloom-weinstein-attorney.html |archivedate=October 9, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Two days later, Weinstein hired [[public relations]] company [[Sitrick and Company]], which specializes in crisis PR;<ref>{{cite news |last=Maddaus |first=Gene |title=Harvey Weinstein Hires Sitrick and Company to Handle Crisis Response After Firing |newspaper=Variety |date=October 9, 2017 |url=https://variety.com/2017/biz/news/harvey-weinstein-sitrick-and-company-crisis-response-1202584227/ |accessdate=November 8, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171109023406/http://variety.com/2017/biz/news/harvey-weinstein-sitrick-and-company-crisis-response-1202584227/ |archivedate=November 9, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> they dropped Weinstein as a client on April 3, 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/harvey-weinstein-dropped-by-crisis-pr-firm-sitrick-1099359|title=Harvey Weinstein Dropped by Crisis PR Firm Sitrick and Company|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|first1=Katie|last=Kilkenny|first2=Rebecca|last2=Sun|date=April 3, 2018|accessdate=April 4, 2018}}</ref> Weinstein's attorney Charles Harder said his client would be suing the ''Times'',<ref>{{cite news |last=Gardner |first=Eriq |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/thr-esq/harvey-weinstein-lawsuit-new-york-times-is-being-prepared-says-his-attorney-1046170 |title=Harvey Weinstein to Sue N.Y. Times, Says His Attorney |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=October 5, 2017 |accessdate=October 5, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171005193904/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/thr-esq/harvey-weinstein-lawsuit-new-york-times-is-being-prepared-says-his-attorney-1046170 |archivedate=October 5, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> but as of October 15, Harder was no longer working for Weinstein.<ref>{{cite web|author1=THR Staff|title=Harvey Weinstein's Attorney Exits Without Filing Threatened N.Y. Times Lawsuit|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/charles-harder-leaves-harvey-weinstein-legal-team-1048956|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=October 16, 2017|language=en|date=October 15, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171015221550/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/charles-harder-leaves-harvey-weinstein-legal-team-1048956|archivedate=October 15, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
In response to the report in ''The New Yorker'', a spokesperson for Weinstein stated:<ref name="Farrow"/>
{{quote|Any allegations of non-consensual sex are unequivocally denied by Mr. Weinstein. Mr. Weinstein has further confirmed that there were never any acts of retaliation against any women for refusing his advances ... Mr. Weinstein has begun counseling, has listened to the community and is pursuing a better path. Mr. Weinstein is hoping that if he makes enough progress, he will be given a second chance.}}
Subsequent reports and accusations of rape were likewise met with the response that "any allegations of nonconsensual sex are unequivocally denied by Mr. Weinstein".<ref name="Gabler"/>
On January 30, 2018, Weinstein's attorney released private emails from [[Ben Affleck]] and [[Jill Messick]], [[Rose McGowan]]'s former manager, that both contradicted McGowan's version of the incident.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Fleming Jr|first1=Mike|title=Harvey Weinstein Uses Emails From Jill Messick, Ben Affleck To Deny Rose McGowan Claims|url=http://deadline.com/2018/01/harvey-weinstein-rose-mcgowan-emails-jill-messick-ben-affleck-sexual-assault-1202274875/|accessdate=February 8, 2018|website=Deadline Hollywood|date=January 31, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Boboltz|first1=Sara|title=Former Miramax Executive And Rose McGowan Manager Jill Messick Dead At 50|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/jill-messick-dead-dies_us_5a7cce14e4b08dfc930225dd|accessdate=February 8, 2018|work=[[The Huffington Post]]|date=February 9, 2018}}</ref> On February 7, 2018 Messick committed suicide.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Hayden|first1=Erik|title=Jill Messick, Producer and Former Rose McGowan Manager, Dies at 50|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/jill-messick-dead-producer-rose-mcgowan-manager-was-50-1083161|accessdate=February 11, 2018|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=February 8, 2018|language=en}}</ref> Both the released email and McGowan's own accusations against Messick led to increased negative public and media attention towards Messick, including [[cyberbullying]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Stadtmiller|first1=Mandy|title=Was 'Mean Girls' Producer Jill Messick Shamed into Suicide?|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/was-mean-girls-producer-jill-messick-shamed-into-suicide?ref=scroll|accessdate=February 10, 2018|work=[[The Daily Beast]]|date=February 11, 2018|language=en}}</ref> Messick's family blamed Weinstein, McGowan, the media and the public for her death.<ref>{{cite news|author1=THR Staff|title=Jill Messick's Family Issues Blistering Statement on Harvey Weinstein and Rose McGowan|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/jill-messicks-family-issues-blistering-statement-harvey-weinstein-rose-mcgowan-1083173|accessdate=February 11, 2018|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=February 8, 2018|language=en}}</ref>
In March 2018, Weinstein's lawyer and spokesperson [[Benjamin Brafman]] said in an interview with ''[[The Times]]'' of London, "The casting couch in Hollywood was not invented by Harvey Weinstein."..."If a woman decides that she needs to have sex with a Hollywood producer to advance her career and actually does it and finds the whole thing offensive, that's not rape." Rhetorically addressing such a woman, Brafman said, "You made a conscious decision that you're willing to do something that is personally offensive in order to advance your career."<ref>{{cite news|last1=Pavia|first1=Will|title=Benjamin Brafman: 'If a woman has sex to help her Hollywood career, that is not rape'|url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/benjamin-brafman-interview-if-a-woman-has-sex-to-help-her-hollywood-career-that-is-not-rape-cdcz2rl6p|accessdate=March 18, 2018|work=The Times|date=March 3, 2018|language=en}}</ref>
==Legal responses== ===Criminal investigations=== In October 2017, the [[New York City Police Department]] (NYPD), London's [[Metropolitan Police Service]] (MPS) and the [[Los Angeles Police Department]] (LAPD) were reviewing allegations against Weinstein following the reporting about his conduct.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/12/harvey-weinstein-nypd-and-london-police-investigating-allegations|title=Harvey Weinstein: police in New York and London investigating allegations|last1=Lartey|first1=Jamiles|date=October 12, 2017|work=The Guardian|accessdate=October 12, 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171012153923/https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/12/harvey-weinstein-nypd-and-london-police-investigating-allegations|archivedate=October 12, 2017|deadurl=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
====New York indictments==== The NYPD said on November 3, 2017 that they were preparing a [[Arrest warrant|warrant]] to arrest Weinstein for his alleged rape of Paz de la Huerta, an investigation that was still pending as of May 2018 and unrelated to the later arrest of Weinstein.<ref name="NYT 3 November 20172">{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/03/nyregion/harvey-weinstein-new-york-police.html|title=Police Building Case to Arrest Harvey Weinstein in Sexual Assault Case|last1=Baker|first1=Al|date=November 3, 2017|work=The New York Times|accessdate=November 3, 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171103212654/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/03/nyregion/harvey-weinstein-new-york-police.html|archivedate=November 3, 2017|deadurl=no|last2=Kantor|first2=Jodi|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2018/may/25/harvey-weinstein-surrenders-over-sexual-misconduct-charges|title=Harvey Weinstein appears in court charged with rape and other sexual offences|last=Holpuch|first=Amanda|last2=Lartey|first2=Jamiles|date=2018-05-25|website=the Guardian|language=en|accessdate=2018-05-27}}</ref>
On May 25, 2018, Weinstein was charged by New York prosecutors with "rape, criminal sex act, sex abuse and sexual misconduct for incidents involving two separate women" following a month long investigation. After surrendering to police, he appeared in [[New York City Criminal Court|court]] before Judge Kevin McGrath. If convicted on the most serious charges, Weinstein could face between 5 and 25 years in prison.<ref name="am New York">{{Cite news|url=https://www.amny.com/news/harvey-weinstein-surrenders-1.18740868|title=Harvey Weinstein charged with rape, sex abuse|work=am New York|accessdate=2018-05-25|language=en}}</ref> Weinstein was released same day on a million dollars cash [[bail]]. He agreed to surrender his passport and to wear an ankle monitor confining him to [[Connecticut]] and New York. His lawyer [[Benjamin Brafman]] said Weinstein intends to plead not guilty.<ref name="The Guardian 25 May 20182">{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2018/may/25/harvey-weinstein-surrenders-over-sexual-misconduct-charges|title=Harvey Weinstein appears in court charged with rape and other sexual offences|last1=Holpuch|first1=Amanda|date=25 May 2018|work=The Guardian|accessdate=25 May 2018|last2=Lartey|first2=Jamiles|language=en}}</ref><ref name="am New York"/>
In July 2018, Weinstein was indicted on an additional charge of "predatory sexual assault" against a woman he allegedly forced into oral sex in 2006. The charge has a maximum sentence of life in prison.<ref>{{cite news |title=Harvey Weinstein Faces New Sex Assault Charges in Manhattan |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/07/02/nyregion/harvey-weinstein-sex.html |accessdate=3 July 2018 |work=New York Times |language=en}}</ref>
On October 11, 2018 a New York judge dismissed one of the sex assault charges against Weinstein.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Sisak |first1=Michael R. |last2=Hays |first2=Tom |title=Harvey Weinstein wins dismissal of one criminal charge |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/world/article-harvey-weinstein-wins-dismissal-of-one-criminal-charge/ |website=[[The Globe and Mail]] |accessdate=11 October 2018 |date=11 October 2018}}</ref>
====Other investigations==== The LAPD investigation concerns an allegation of rape by an unnamed actress.<ref name="auto1"/>
As of February 2018, the London MPS were investigating 15 alleged sexual assaults by Weinstein, dating back to the 1990s. The investigation is dubbed "Operation [[Mount Kaguyak|Kaguyak]]".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://variety.com/2018/tv/news/scotland-yard-weinstein-operation-kaguyak-1202712888/|title=Scotland Yard Investigates Complaint Against Harvey Weinstein From 10th Alleged Victim (EXCLUSIVE)|last1=Clarke|first1=Stewart|date=28 February 2018|work=Variety|accessdate=28 February 2018}}</ref>
===Civil lawsuits=== On October 23, 2017, [[Attorney General of New York|New York Attorney General]] [[Eric Schneiderman]] opened a civil rights investigation into [[The Weinstein Company]] (TWC). He issued a [[subpoena]] for records related to sexual harassment and discrimination complaints at the company.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/23/harvey-weinstein-new-york-attorney-general-investigation|title=Weinstein Company under investigation by New York attorney general|last1=Levin|first1=Sam|date=October 23, 2017|work=The Guardian|accessdate=October 24, 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171023234151/https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/23/harvey-weinstein-new-york-attorney-general-investigation|archivedate=October 23, 2017|deadurl=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
In January 2018, Weinstein's former personal assistant Sandeep Rehal sued both Weinstein brothers and TWC for discrimination and harassment, alleging that much of her work involved "catering to Harvey Weinstein's sexual appetites and activities", including working while he was naked. Weinstein denied these allegations.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/thr-esq/harvey-weinsteins-assistant-sues-harassment-says-he-regularly-dictated-emails-naked-1078407|title=Harvey Weinstein's Ex-Assistant Sues for Harassment, Says He Regularly Dictated Emails Naked|last1=Cullins|first1=Ashley|date=25 January 2018|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=30 January 2018|language=en}}</ref>
On April 30, 2018, [[Ashley Judd]] sued Weinstein for allegedly making false statements about her after she rejected his sexual requests which damaged her career and cost her a role in a ''[[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|Lord of the Rings]]'' movie.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/30/business/media/ashley-judd-harvey-weinstein-lawsuit.html|title=Ashley Judd Sues Harvey Weinstein, Saying He Harmed Her Career|date=2018-04-30|work=The New York Times|accessdate=2018-05-08|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>
==Reactions== {{See also|Me Too movement}} Weinstein's alleged actions were widely criticized by prominent persons in entertainment and politics. They triggered a public discussion about, as the [[Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences]] (AMPAS) put it, "willful ignorance and shameful complicity in sexually predatory behavior and workplace harassment" in the film industry.<ref name="The Guardian October 14, 2017">{{cite news|last1=Lartey|first1=Jamiles|last2=Helmore|first2=Edward|last3=Batty|first3=David|title=Stars welcome Academy move to expel Weinstein over sexual assault claims|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/14/harvey-weinstein-oscars-academy-holds-emergency-meeting|accessdate=October 14, 2017|work=The Guardian|date=October 14, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171014085543/https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/14/harvey-weinstein-oscars-academy-holds-emergency-meeting|archivedate=October 14, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
===Business and professional associations=== On October 8, 2017, The Weinstein Company's (TWC) board of directors dismissed Weinstein,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-41546694 |title=Harvey Weinstein sacked after sexual harassment claims |publisher=BBC News Online |date=October 9, 2017 |accessdate=October 9, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171009001510/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-41546694 |archivedate=October 9, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> and he resigned from the company's board nine days later.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Patten|first1=Dominic|title=Harvey Weinstein Resigns From TWC Board As Termination Ratified In Meeting|url=http://deadline.com/2017/10/harvey-weinstein-board-meeting-weinstein-company-termination-future-1202189421/|accessdate=October 17, 2017|website=Deadline Hollywood|date=October 17, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171017215046/http://deadline.com/2017/10/harvey-weinstein-board-meeting-weinstein-company-termination-future-1202189421/|archivedate=October 17, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
After Weinstein's ouster was announced, several companies ended their collaborations with TWC, including [[Apple Inc.|Apple]] (October 9),<ref>{{cite web |last1=Andreeva |first1=Nellie |title=Apple Kills Deal For TWC Elvis Series In Wake Of Harvey Weinstein Scandal |url=http://deadline.com/2017/10/elvis-tv-series-terminated-harvey-weinstein-scandal-apple-1202185031/ |website=Deadline Hollywood |accessdate=October 14, 2017 |date=October 9, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171013212007/http://deadline.com/2017/10/elvis-tv-series-terminated-harvey-weinstein-scandal-apple-1202185031/ |archivedate=October 13, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> [[Hachette (publisher)|Hachette]] (October 12),<ref>{{cite news |last1=Barr |first1=Jeremy |title=Weinstein Books Imprint Terminated by Hachette Group (Exclusive) |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/hachette-book-group-terminates-weinstein-books-imprint-1048087 |accessdate=October 12, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=October 12, 2017 |language=en |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171012203431/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/hachette-book-group-terminates-weinstein-books-imprint-1048087 |archivedate=October 12, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> [[Amazon (company)|Amazon]] (October 13),<ref>{{cite web |last1=Lincoln |first1=Ross A. |title=Amazon Axes David O. Russell Series, Cuts Ties With TWC |url=https://www.thewrap.com/amazon-axes-david-o-russell-series-cuts-ties-twc/ |publisher=The Wrap |accessdate=October 14, 2017 |date=October 13, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171014055848/https://www.thewrap.com/amazon-axes-david-o-russell-series-cuts-ties-twc/ |archivedate=October 14, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> [[Lexus]] and [[Ovation (U.S. TV channel)|Ovation]] (October 25).<ref>{{cite news|last1=Petski|first1=Denise|title=Lexus & Ovation Latest To Cut Ties With Harvey Weinstein|url=http://deadline.com/2017/10/lexus-ovation-cut-ties-harvey-weinstein-project-runway-1202194387/|accessdate=October 25, 2017|website=Deadline Hollywood|date=October 25, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171025182100/http://deadline.com/2017/10/lexus-ovation-cut-ties-harvey-weinstein-project-runway-1202194387/|archivedate=October 25, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref> The AMPAS, the [[British Academy of Film and Television Arts]] (BAFTA), the [[Producers Guild of America]] (PGA), and the [[Academy of Television Arts & Sciences]] (ATAS) also stripped Weinstein of their memberships.<ref name="The Guardian October 14, 2017"/><ref>{{cite news |title=Bafta suspends Harvey Weinstein |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-41586442 |publisher=BBC News Online |date=October 11, 2017 |accessdate=November 15, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171129004147/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-41586442 |archivedate=November 29, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/academy-expels-harvey-weinstein-1202590109/|title=Harvey Weinstein Stripped of Academy Membership|last=Tapley|first=Kristopher|journal=Variety|publisher=Penske Business Media|date=October 14, 2017|accessdate=November 3, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171103140809/http://variety.com/2017/film/news/academy-expels-harvey-weinstein-1202590109/|archivedate=November 3, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Robb|first1=David|title=Producers Guild Board Votes Unanimously To Expel Harvey Weinstein|url=http://deadline.com/2017/10/harvey-weinstein-producers-guild-of-america-expelled-pga-1202189258/|website=Deadline Hollywood|accessdate=October 17, 2017|date=October 16, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171016233050/http://deadline.com/2017/10/harvey-weinstein-producers-guild-of-america-expelled-pga-1202189258/|archivedate=October 16, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/television-academy-votes-expel-harvey-weinstein-life-1055553|title=Television Academy Votes to Expel Harvey Weinstein for Life|last1=Huff|first1=Lauren|last2=Rahman|first2=Abid|date=November 6, 2017|work=The Hollywood Reporter|publisher=Eldridge Industries|accessdate=November 14, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171111030252/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/television-academy-votes-expel-harvey-weinstein-life-1055553|archivedate=November 11, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
===Politics=== Prominent politicians condemned Weinstein's actions. [[Hillary Clinton]], [[Barack Obama]] and [[Michelle Obama]] denounced Weinstein's reported behavior on October 10, 2017.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Blistein |first1=Jon |title=Hillary Clinton, Obamas Rebuke Harvey Weinstein After Assault Allegations |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/news/hillary-clinton-obamas-rebuke-harvey-weinstein-w508181 |accessdate=October 11, 2017 |work=[[Rolling Stone]] |date=October 10, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171011043344/http://www.rollingstone.com/movies/news/hillary-clinton-obamas-rebuke-harvey-weinstein-w508181 |archivedate=October 11, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> French President [[Emmanuel Macron]] initiated the revocation of Weinstein's [[Legion of Honor]] title.<ref name="BBC-41629689">{{cite web |title=UK police investigate new Weinstein claims |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-41629689 |publisher=BBC News Online |accessdate=October 15, 2017 |date=October 15, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171015144321/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-41629689 |archivedate=October 15, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> In the UK, [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] members of parliament requested the revocation of Weinstein's [[Order of the British Empire|Commander of the Order of the British Empire]] honorary title.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Ritman|first1=Alex|title=British Government Under Pressure to Strip Harvey Weinstein of Honorary CBE|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/harvey-weinstein-british-politicians-ask-prime-minister-revoke-cbe-honor-1047659|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=October 20, 2017|language=en|date=October 11, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171019222224/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/harvey-weinstein-british-politicians-ask-prime-minister-revoke-cbe-honor-1047659|archivedate=October 19, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
Several politicians Weinstein had supported gave his donations to charities, including Democratic Senators [[Al Franken]],<ref>{{cite web |last1=Rao |first1=Maya |title=Sen. Al Franken to donate campaign contributions from Harvey Weinstein |url=http://www.startribune.com/sen-al-franken-to-return-campaign-contributions-from-harvey-weinstein/449800623/ |work=[[Star Tribune]] |accessdate=October 14, 2017 |date=October 6, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171015124512/http://www.startribune.com/sen-al-franken-to-return-campaign-contributions-from-harvey-weinstein/449800623/ |archivedate=October 15, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> [[Patrick Leahy]], and [[Martin Heinrich]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Tatum |first1=Sophie |title=Democrats pressured to return Weinstein donations |url=http://www.cnn.com/2017/10/05/politics/harvey-weinstein-donations/index.html |publisher=CNN |accessdate=October 14, 2017 |date=October 5, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171015184819/http://www.cnn.com/2017/10/05/politics/harvey-weinstein-donations/index.html |archivedate=October 15, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
===Other reactions=== Weinstein's wife [[Georgina Chapman]] announced her divorce on October 10, 2017.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/harvey-weinstein-wife-georgina-chapman-divorcing-divorce-1202586378/ |title=Harvey Weinstein's Wife Georgina Chapman Divorcing Him |last=Saperstein |first=Pat |date=October 10, 2017 |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate=October 10, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171011000338/http://variety.com/2017/film/news/harvey-weinstein-wife-georgina-chapman-divorcing-divorce-1202586378/ |archivedate=October 11, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> That month, the [[University at Buffalo]], Weinstein's alma mater, revoked his honorary degree,<ref>{{cite news|author1=Associated Press|title=University at Buffalo moves to revoke Harvey Weinstein's honorary degree|url=http://www.syracuse.com/state/index.ssf/2017/10/university_at_buffalo_moves_to_revoke_harvey_weinsteins_honorary_degree.html|accessdate=October 24, 2017|work=Syracuse.com|date=October 11, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171025073630/http://www.syracuse.com/state/index.ssf/2017/10/university_at_buffalo_moves_to_revoke_harvey_weinsteins_honorary_degree.html|archivedate=October 25, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref> and [[Harvard University]] rescinded Weinstein's 2014 [[W. E. B. Du Bois]] medal.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/18/us/harvey-weinstein-award.html|title=Harvard Revokes Du Bois Medal Awarded to Harvey Weinstein|last=Saul|first=Stephanie|date=October 18, 2017|work=The New York Times|accessdate=October 24, 2017|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171024171646/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/18/us/harvey-weinstein-award.html|archivedate=October 24, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
On [[New Year's Day]] 2018, more than 300 Hollywood actresses and other women published an open letter in the daily newspapers ''The New York Times'' and ''[[La Opinión]]'' appealing to support the initiative [[Time's Up (movement)|Time's Up]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Home|url=https://www.timesupnow.com/|website=Time's Up Now|accessdate=1 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Buckley|first1=Cara|title=Powerful Hollywood Women Unveil Anti-Harassment Action Plan|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/01/movies/times-up-hollywood-women-sexual-harassment.html|accessdate=1 January 2018|work=The New York Times|date=1 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Actrices crean un fondo legal contra abusos sexuales a mujeres|url=https://laopinion.com/2018/01/01/increible-actrices-crean-un-fondo-legal-contra-abusos-sexuales-a-mujeres/|accessdate=1 January 2018|work=La Opinión|date=1 January 2018|language=es-ES}}</ref>
==Impact== {{main|Weinstein effect}}
===In the United States=== The October 2017 allegations against Weinstein precipitated an immediate "national reckoning" against sexual harassment and assault in the United States,{{r|Rutenberg: Reckoning}} known as the "Weinstein effect". Compounded by other sexual harassment cases earlier in the year, the Weinstein reports and the subsequent "[[Me Too (hashtag)|#MeToo]]" hashtag campaign, which encouraged individuals to share their suppressed stories of sexual misconduct, created a cavalcade of allegations across multiple industries that brought about the swift ouster of many men in positions of power both in the United States and, as it spread, around the world.{{r|Cook/Simons|USA Today 2017-10-25}} In the entertainment industry, allegations led to the ousters of actors and directors alike. Most prominently, actor [[Kevin Spacey]], comedian [[Louis C.K.]], and filmmaker [[Brett Ratner]] had projects canceled following at least six allegations apiece.{{r|AP: Impact Nov 10}} Over 200 women accused filmmaker [[James Toback]] of sexual harassment.{{r|USA Today 2017-10-25}} In journalism, allegations led to the ousters of editors, publishers, executives, and hosts. In other industries, the [[celebrity chef]] [[John Besh]] and other executives in finance and public relations were removed.{{r|USA Today 2017-10-25|AP: Impact Nov 10}} As of November 25, 2017, the [[Los Angeles Police Department]] was investigating 28 sex crime cases involving media figures.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Haring|first1=Bruce|title=LAPD Has 28 Open Sex Crimes Investigations Of Hollywood And Media|url=http://deadline.com/2017/11/lapd-has-28-open-sex-crimes-investigations-on-hollywood-and-media-1202214547/|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|accessdate=November 26, 2017|date=November 25, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171125223148/http://deadline.com/2017/11/lapd-has-28-open-sex-crimes-investigations-on-hollywood-and-media-1202214547/|archivedate=November 25, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
[[Time (magazine)|''Time'' magazine]] dubbed the "Silence Breakers" behind the #MeToo movement [[Time Person of the Year|''Time'' Person of the Year]] in 2017.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Zacharek|first1=Stephanie|last2=Dockterman|first2=Eliana|last3=Edwards|first3=Haley Sweetland|title=TIME Person of the Year 2017: The Silence Breakers|url=http://time.com/time-person-of-the-year-2017-silence-breakers/|accessdate=December 6, 2017|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206124523/http://time.com/time-person-of-the-year-2017-silence-breakers/|archivedate=December 6, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref> American journalists in conversation at [[NPR]] wrote of the series of allegations feeling like a [[Tipping point (sociology)|tipping point]] for societal treatment of sexual misconduct, distinguished from prior sexual misconduct public debates by the public trust put in the celebrity accusers, as opposed to prior cases of publicly unknown accusers.{{r|NPR: Tipping Point}} Other journalists doubted that the trend would hold.{{r|USA Today 2017-10-25}}
''The New York Times'' and ''The New Yorker'' jointly won the 2018 [[Pulitzer Prize for Public Service]] "for their coverage of the sexual abuse of women in Hollywood and other industries around the world".<ref>{{cite news|last1=Laforme|first1=Ren|title=Here are the winners of the 2018 Pulitzer Prizes|url=https://www.poynter.org/news/here-are-winners-2018-pulitzer-prizes|accessdate=April 16, 2018|work=Poynter|date=April 16, 2018|language=en}}</ref>
===Internationally=== The "Me Too" campaign spread to other countries and languages over social media in Asia, Europe, Latin and North America.<ref>{{cite news|title=Powerful men confronted as "Weinstein Effect" goes global|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/harvey-weinstein-effect-goes-global-powerful-men-confronted|accessdate=1 January 2018|work=CBS News|date=14 November 2017|language=en}}</ref>
In North America, Canadian comedy festival founder [[Gilbert Rozon]] resigned and over a dozen individuals accused Quebec television host and producer [[Éric Salvail]] of sexual misconduct.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Perreaux|first1=Les|title=Canadian entertainment leaders Gilbert Rozon and Éric Salvail resign amid sexual assault, harassment allegations|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/ex-just-for-laughs-head-gilbert-rozon-faces-sexual-assault-harassment-allegations/article36661216/|accessdate=1 January 2018|work=The Globe and Mail|date=19 October 2017}}</ref>
In Europe, allegations against multiple British politicians created [[Westminster sexual harassment scandal|a public scandal]] and led to the suspension and resignations of three officials. In France,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Willsher|first1=Kim|title=Allegations of sexual violence soar in France after Weinstein scandal|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/nov/14/france-sees-sharp-rise-in-reports-of-sexual-misconduct|accessdate=1 January 2018|work=The Guardian|date=14 November 2017}}</ref> political organizations close to the [[Socialist Party (France)|Socialist Party]], in particular the [[Union Nationale des Étudiants de France]] (UNEF), were accused of systemic sexual harassment. The French daily newspaper ''[[Le Monde]]'' published in November 2017 two articles on alleged sexual harassment and predation supported by former UNEF presidents, Jean-Baptiste Prévost and Emmanuel Zemmour.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Mestre|first1=Abel|title=Harcèlement sexuel : la parole se libère à l'UNEF|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/societe/article/2017/11/17/harcelement-sexuel-les-langues-se-delient-a-l-unef_5216167_3224.html|accessdate=1 January 2018|work=[[Le Monde]]|date=17 November 2017|language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Mestre|first1=Abel|last2=Zappi|first2=Sylvia|title=Enquête sur un système de violences sexistes au sein du syndicat étudiant UNEF|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/societe/article/2017/11/28/a-l-unef-revelations-sur-un-systeme-de-predation-sexuelle-generalise_5221306_3224.html|accessdate=1 January 2018|work=Le Monde|date=28 November 2017|language=fr}}</ref> In an editorial, more than 80 UNEF female members and militants came forward to accuse the Union of "sexual violence".<ref>{{cite news|title=" Militantes, nous dénonçons les violences sexistes et sexuelles à l'UNEF "|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/idees/article/2017/11/28/militantes-nous-denoncons-les-violences-sexistes-et-sexuelles-a-l-unef_5221317_3232.html|accessdate=1 January 2018|work=Le Monde|date=28 November 2017|language=fr}}</ref>

#REDIRECT [[Comedy#History]] [[Category:Comedy]]

{{Infobox video game series|genre=Adventure|platforms=PC|year of inception=1998}}
'''''Horké léto''''' is a video game series, beginning with '''''Horké léto''''' a 1998 Czech adventure game developed by Czech studio Maxon and published by JRC Interactive. A sequel entitled '''''Horké léto 2: Majer se vrací ''''' was developed by Centauri Production and published in 1999 by JRC Interactive. '''''[[Žhavé léto 3 ½]]''''' rounds off the trilogy as a 2006 action/adventure/driving game developed by Centauri Production and CINEMAX,and published by Akella. '''''Evil Days of Luckless John''''' (Czech: '''''Žhavé léto 3 ½'''''; Russian: '''''Сорвать Куш''''') is a 2006 Czech action adventure video game developed by Centauri Production and published by Playlogic. It is a spin-off to ''Horké léto''. In Russia it was published by Akella.<ref name="adventuregamers.com">{{cite web|url=https://adventuregamers.com/articles/view/17966|title=Evil Days of Luckless John preview|last=Kiai|first=Deirdra|date=July 14, 2006|website=Adventure Gamers|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
==Production== Graphics were created by Marek Píša. Píša and Viktor Bocan participated in writing the screenplay. Sounds and music were the work of William Foldes. All characters are voiced by comedian Zdeněk Izer, a notable Czech impersonator, besides some female characters. The game has the same humorous style seen across Czech adventures such as [[Polda]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite book|url=https://dspace.cuni.cz/bitstream/handle/20.500.11956/52702/DPTX_2010_2_11230_0_322985_0_111952.pdf?sequence=1|title=Historie a kontext produkce počítačových her žánru adventure v České republice|last=Raková|first=Michaela|publisher=UNIVERZITA KARLOVA V PRAZE|year=2013|isbn=|location=Prague|pages=}}</ref> It was the first Czech game with professional dubbing.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://magazin.aktualne.cz/obrazem/foto-nejslavnejsi-ceske-pc-hry/r~63789fd294b511e3b25d002590604f2e/r~c912a0c094b211e3b1d7002590604f2e/|title=FOTO Nejslavnější české hry. Od Izera po mafii|last=|first=|date=2014-02-13|work=Aktuálně.cz|access-date=2018-10-02|language=cs-CZ}}</ref> The game's most famous quote comes in its opening scene: "''I am an ordinary kid. Guys call me Rambo and girls [call me] asshole. Otherwise, I'm Majer. Honza Majer''".<ref name=":1" /> Like many other domestic video games of the era, Horke Leto was intended to appeal directly to Czech and Slovak players.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://www.excalibur.cz/retro/legendarni-ceske-adventury-horke-leto/|title=Legendární české adventury – Horké léto|last=Nahodil|first=Martin|date=April 4, 2018|work=Excalibur.cz|access-date=2018-10-02|language=cs-CZ}}</ref> The game became a phenomenon upon its release and it immediately ranked among the best Czech adventures ever.<ref name="auto">{{cite web|url=https://refresher.cz/25610-Vybrali-jsme-ty-nejlepsi-ceske-a-slovenske-hry-Shodnes-se-s-nasi-top-dvacitkou|title=Vybrali jsme ty nejlepší české a slovenské hry. Shodneš se s naší top dvacítkou?|last=Ondřej J.|first=|date=April 16, 2015|website=REFRESHER.sk|publisher=|language=sk|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Petr Ticháček wrote for BonusWeb in 2003 that the fan base of the game had heavily diminished.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://gamesite.zoznam.sk/ostatne/tematicke-clanky/26754-zabudnuty-klenot-videoherneho-priemyslu-cesko-slovenske-point-click-adventury|title=Zabudnutý klenot videoherného priemyslu – česko-slovenské point&click adventúry|last=Čelár|first=Ľubomír|date=October 24, 2016|work=Gamesite.sk|access-date=2018-10-02|language=sk-SK}}</ref>
According to Miroslav Mrňa, the idea of a sequel was brought up by JRC, then an exclusive distributor for the first game; the developers found this proposition interesting so pursued it. Developments began in late December 1998.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://bonusweb.idnes.cz/miroslav-mrna-o-horkem-lete-2-dgd-/Magazin.aspx?c=A000131_mirekmrnahl2b_bw|title=Miroslav Mrňa o Horkém Létě 2|last=Ticháček|first=Petr|date=January 4, 2000|website=iDNES.cz|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-10-02}}</ref> The team consisted of one scriptwriter, two programmers, three graphic artists and two musicians.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://bonusweb.idnes.cz/mirek-mrna-o-priprave-horkeho-leta-2-duh-/Magazin.aspx?c=A000131_miramrnahl2a_bw|title=Mirek Mrňa o přípravě Horkého Léta 2|last=Polách|first=Zdeněk|date=April 12, 1999|website=iDNES.cz|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-10-02}}</ref> Mrna described the development and production process of the game in detail for iDNES.cz.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://zpravy.idnes.cz/jak-se-vytvarelo-horke-leto-2-dgn-/zahranicni.aspx?c=991107_214105_pocnovinky_ond|title=Jak se vytvářelo Horké léto 2|last=Mrňa|first=Miroslav|date=November 8, 1999|website=iDNES.cz|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-10-03}}</ref> For Horke Leto 2, a watercolour-style design was made for the backgrounds, which were painted by hand then scanned into the computer. They were inspired by designs from painter Jan Štěpánek.<ref name=":0" /> By mid-November, the game was expected to be released in time for the Christmas season.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://bonusweb.idnes.cz/horke-leto-2-cxg-/Novinky.aspx?c=A000216_horkeleto2991118_bw|title=Horké Léto 2 update|last=Polách|first=Zdeněk|date=November 18, 1999|website=iDNES.cz|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-10-02}}</ref> The game would be released at the same time as Polda 2, and there was a friendly rivalry between the two titles.<ref name=":0" /> Horke Leto 2 caught the attention of Bonusweb during development, who devoted a considerable amount of airtime to the game, including a series of news articles where they observed the game's development, to a preview and review, a tutorial, an interview with project lead Miroslav Mrňa, and finally a demo.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://bonusweb.idnes.cz/demo-horke-leto-2-02p-/Clanek.aspx?c=A000131_horkeleto2demo_bw|title=Demo: Horké Léto 2|last=Polách|first=Zdeněk|date=January 7, 2000|website=iDNES.cz|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-10-03}}</ref> IDEA Games completed a conversion of the game for iOS and Android platforms in 2012; players should access a 30 minute episode before having to pay to complete the rest of the adventure.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.denik.cz/hry/horke-leto-2-na-iphonech-a-ipadech-izer-po-30-minut-zdarma-pak-zaplatit-20120302.html|title=Horké léto 2 na iPhonech a iPadech: Izer po 30 minut zdarma, pak zaplatit|last=Redakce|first=|date=February 3, 2012|work=Deník.cz|access-date=2018-10-02|language=cs}}</ref> The game was re-released with updated graphics.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://games.tiscali.cz/prvni-dojmy/horke-leto-2-obstala-ceska-klasika-s-izerem-v-ios-konkurenci-227253|title=Horké léto 2 - obstála česká klasika s Izerem v iOS konkurenci?|last=Poláček|first=Petr|date=May 4, 2012|website=Games.cz|language=cs|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-10-02}}</ref>
While developers from Centauri Production wanted to make a second sequel to the game, they were unable to obtain the rights to the name "Horke Leto" or the main character Honza, however the title was still designed as a spiritual sequel. Its original title was meant to be Raiders of the Lost Casino, but this was only used for international distribution purposes.<ref name=":0" /> It was announced in May 2005 for release in the third quarter of that year.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bluesnews.com/s/57146/raiders-of-the-lost-casino|title=Raiders of the Lost Casino|last=|first=|date=May 22, 2005|website=Blue's News|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-10-02}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.gamekult.com/actualite/une-video-de-raiders-of-the-lost-casino-41536.html|title=Une vidéo de Raiders of the Lost Casino|last=Poischich|first=|date=June 1, 2005|work=Gamekult|access-date=2018-10-02|language=fr}}</ref> The game's original title was "Raiders of the Lost Casino", a reference to the Indiana Jones film [[Raiders of the Lost Ark]]. the game's visual style is both cartoon-like and gritty.<ref name="adventuregamers.com" /> The game was originally supposed to be released in the first few weeks of 2006.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jeuxvideo.com/news/2005/00014830.htm|title=Images: Raiders Of The Lost Casino joue de malchance|last=Writing staff|first=|date=December 16, 2005|website=Jeuxvideo.com|publisher=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> This was later pushed to February of that year.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://stopgame.ru/newsdata/1966|title=Акелла срывает куш|last=|first=|date=January 12, 2006|website=StopGame.ru|publisher=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Akella demonstrated the game as a work-in-progress at E3 2006.<ref name="adventuregamers.com" /> Akella planned an English release for the end of 2006.<ref name="adventuregamers.com" /> A French localisation would later be made.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jeuxpo.com/game_test-3562.html|title=Evil Days of Luckless John|last=|first=|date=2007|website=Jeuxpo.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
==Plot and gameplay== In ''Horké léto'', the player takes control of teenager Honza Majer, who must rescue his family after they were captured by cannibals. In ''Horké léto 2'', Honza Majer must retrieve the Purple Salamander artefact from the bandit One-Eye Dingo. ''Žhavé léto 3 ½'' sees the player take control of Honza's grandfather, the hapless protagonist Johnny Majer, in the 1920s as he verses the Mafia in the age of the prohibition. Set in the gangster age of the 1930s, the player takes control of the handsome street rat Johnny who inherits a casino, only to discover that there is a plot to expropriate it.<ref name="adventuregamers.com" />
The first two games are point and click adventures controlled by the mouse. The third is mainly a point and click adventure with elements of stealth, fighting, driving, and shoot ‘em up.
==Critical reception== ===Horké léto=== Refresher.cz deemed it an average game, but noted that it didn't stop it from becoming a domestic hit.<ref name="auto"/> Doupe.cz wrote the game is one of the best Czech adventures that every player should play.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://doupe.zive.cz/clanek/horke-leto-aneb-majer-v-akci|title=Horké léto aneb Majer v akci|last=Gric|first=Kamil|date=June 21, 2001|website=Doupe.cz|publisher=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Excalibur suggests that while the graphics and gameplay were nothing special, it was the dubbing into local languages that captured the imagination of Czecheslovakia.<ref name=":0" /> PC Tuning deemed it one of the 10 best Czech games of all time.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://pctuning.tyden.cz/multimedia/hry-a-zabava/28514-top-10-nejlepsich-ceskych-her-vsech-dob?start=2|title=Top 10 nejlepších českých her všech dob|last=Jiříková|first=Lucie|date=November 27, 2013|website=PCTuning.cz|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-10-02}}</ref> Refresher thought it was the 20th best Czech title, praising its funny dialogues and first-class dubbing.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://refresher.cz/25610-Vybrali-jsme-ty-nejlepsi-ceske-a-slovenske-hry-Shodnes-se-s-nasi-top-dvacitkou|title=Vybrali jsme ty nejlepší české a slovenské hry. Shodneš se s naší top dvacítkou?|last=Ondřej J.|first=|date=April 16, 2015|website=Refresher|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
===Horké léto 2=== Upon a preview, Bonusweb hoped that the game's humour would outweigh its average graphics and animations making it an above-average Czech title.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://bonusweb.idnes.cz/horke-leto-2-cxg-/Preview.aspx?c=A000130_horkeleto2pre_bw|title=Horké léto 2 preview|last=Ticháček|first=Petr|date=July 25, 1999|website=iDNES.cz|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-10-02}}</ref> Bonusweb.cz compared the title to [[Polda 2]], and ultimately decided that despite its limitations it was worth a play.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://bonusweb.idnes.cz/horke-leto-2-cxg-/Recenze.aspx?c=A000213_horkeleto2_bw|title=Horké Léto 2|date=13 December 1999|website=iDNES.cz}}</ref>
===Žhavé léto 3 ½=== The game received mixed reviews from critics who enjoyed the game's artistic style and story but disliked its gameplay and interface. Hexus disliked the clunky interface, though praised the graphics.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hexus.net/gaming/reviews/pc/9602-the-evil-days-luckless-john-pc/?page=3|title=The Evil Days of Luckless John - PC|publisher=}}</ref> Adventure Classic Gaming felt the game was a disappointing attempt to recapture the classic point and click adventures of the late 20th century.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.adventureclassicgaming.com/index.php/site/reviews/443/|title=Evil Days of Luckless John - Review - Adventure Classic Gaming - ACG - Adventure Games, Interactive Fiction Games - Reviews, Interviews, Features, Previews, Cheats, Galleries, Forums|website=www.adventureclassicgaming.com}}</ref> Adventures Planet noted the strange mix of genres, that saw arcade-style gameplay be followed by Myst-style puzzles.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.adventuresplanet.it/scheda_recensione.php?game=raiderscasino#.WrwieehubIU|title=Adventure's Planet - Recensione : Evil Days of Luckless John|website=www.adventuresplanet.it}}</ref> Bonusweb felt that despite the game's limitations, it was genuinely surprising.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://bonusweb.idnes.cz/zhave-leto-3-a-pul-0kx-/Recenze.aspx?c=A060103_zl3apulrec_bw|title=Žhavé léto 3 a půl|date=6 January 2006|website=iDNES.cz}}</ref> Game Watcher deemed the title "pretty poor".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.gamewatcher.com/games/evil-days-of-luckless-john|title=Evil Days of Luckless John PC Summary - GameWatcher|website=www.gamewatcher.com}}</ref> Game Slave thought ''John'' was a great idea that was poorly executed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gameslave.co.uk/content/evil-days-of-luckless-john-review/|title=Evil Days of Luckless John Review, gameSlave|last=gameslave.co.uk|first=Craig Dudley,|website=www.gameslave.co.uk}}</ref> 4 Players felt a lot of the humour fell flat.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.4players.de/4players.php/dispbericht_fazit/PC-CDROM/Test/Fazit_Wertung/PC-CDROM/9509/5767/Evil_Days_of_Luckless_John.html|title=Test (Wertung) zu Evil Days of Luckless John (Adventure) - 4Players.de|publisher=}}</ref> Jeux Video offered a funny and endearing experience.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jeuxvideo.com/articles/0000/00007930-evil-days-of-luckless-john-test.htm|title=Test Evil Days Of Luckless John sur PC|publisher=}}</ref> Adventure Treff felt the game was more likely to induce annoyance than fun.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.adventure-treff.de/spiele-datenbank/11278-evil-days-of-luckless-john7|title=Evil Days of Luckless John|last=Frank|first=Hans|website=Adventure-Treff}}</ref> PC Guru thought the game was fun despite its graphics.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pcguru.hu/teszt/evil-days-of-luckless-john/334|title=Evil Days of Luckless John|publisher=}}</ref> Bonusweb compared the game favorably to [[Polda 5]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://bonusweb.idnes.cz/zhave-leto-3-a-pul-0kx-/Recenze.aspx?c=A060103_zl3apulrec_bw|title=Žhavé léto 3 a půl|date=6 January 2006|website=iDNES.cz}}</ref> Tiscalo felt the game's screenshots were reminiscent of Full Throttle.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://games.tiscali.cz/obrazky/vice-o-ceske-hre-raiders-of-the-lost-casino-zhave-leto-3-a-pul-23900|title=Více o české hře Raiders of the Lost Casino (Žhavé léto 3 a půl) - Games.cz|last=Tiscali|website=Games.cz|language=cs|access-date=2018-10-02}}</ref>
